body: Agree.  We'll also need to push some changes to jupyter docker stacks
So the sparkr tarball is removed in 0.2.x.

Test failed with 

```
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/Module
    at play.api.libs.json.Json$.stringify(Json.scala:51)
    at 

```

Looks suspicious.
I think the fix is to add the jackson test dependency to https://github.com/apache/incubator-toree/blob/87a9eb8ad08406ce0747e92f7714d4eb54153293/communication/build.sbt

adding to communication alone wan't sufficient. added the jackson test dep to base ToreeProject instead.
I still get some errors on "make test" but those are the same that I get in a baseline without my change
@fiskl @lbustelo @chipsenkbeil Do you guys want me to rebase this over to the master branch?
It looks like travis is now happy.
@okoethibm This had been merged both in `master` and in `0.1.x` branch. Can you close this PR?
It can be rebased, but I don't want to merge it in since it has while loops checking a ready states. I think that needs to be reworked.

Yeah I'll clean it up a bit with the comments In here.

Ugh order dependent jupyter kernel test failures again. :(
I'm being bitten by this very issue myself, a fix would be appreciated

I'm not sure if this is the right place to comment, but having just switched to Toree it seems like this is just a symptom of the lack of :paste mode, along with having to use braces to give companion objects the same scope as their class, and not being able to do method chaining with dots at the beginnings of lines.

I know there are line magics, but I wonder if there's a way (maybe through a notebook magic) to make each cell be sent to the interpreter in :paste mode and disable the line-by-line functionality. This would bring things much more in line experientially with other REPLs.
Instructions of how to get the KEY at https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/incubator/impala/KEYS
I do not see where other projects are adding a KEYS file in their source, so I'm only placing this on the dist.
@lbustelo this is ready for review now.
@lbustelo round 2

Thanks a lot for this one.

Is there some way we can reliably test this?

Probably the easiest spot is in the kernel gateway tests.
@chipsenkbeil @lbustelo Any objections to merging this guy.  Tested it locally and all seems well.

While I can't say I'm thrilled with adding another method to the interpreter trait, I'm not going to hold this one up.

Ideally, we would convert all of our startup code to use the plugin architecture. We'd then tack on some plugins to run when the SparkSession and SparkContext are available, which would then look up the interpreters and bind appropriately.

For now, this is okay. I'd say we add `@experimental` to the `postInit` method or mark in the docs that it could be dropped in later versions.
Okay sounds good.  Do we need to hold another vote?
I'm not sure. I'll ask on the mailing list. Going to merge this in.

There are 2 minor code changes in this PR:
-Add Flush Method to Logger object so it can be compliant with stream interface
-In the loop that pull code_info from the queue, make sure we have a new code_info before setting the current one to null. Reason is that in some cases (say Spark Streaming for example), the cell may have finished executing but there is still data coming down
Looks good to me
Can you make an issue on the Toree JIRA for this and link it in your PR title?
Looks good to me, merging this in.
/cc @chipsenkbeil
@mariusvniekerk If this looks good to you. I think you should do the merge.
:shipit:

Probably best to have a jira from a tracking perspective. 

@lbustelo @chipsenkbeil does it make sense to also add a post cell run event for the plug-in system?
Yeah that seems like a good idea.  We might also want that same place to hold some notion of the type contract that implementers should expect?
@DTAIEB I believe that the scalatest for this would need to be adjusted since you have more messages floating around now.

@mariusvniekerk : I will look at updating the scalatests and create a JIRA to track.
@chipsenkbeil : I agree with the idea of centralizing the event names and we should include the existing events as well. I can look at making these changes if everyone agrees.

@mariusvniekerk, what did you have in mind for contracts?

@DTAIEB, go for it.
@mariusvniekerk, any reason why this hasn't been merged in?
@lbustelo, is this still relevant?
@mariusvniekerk, still need to be done? LGTM.

@mariusvniekerk It looks like the pluginsManager is not mocked in the scalatest causing a NullPointer exception. I fixed it by adding a check, probably best to have someone update the code to mock the pluginsManager.
Waiting for Travis to complete the tests (for some reason, the build has been stuck in Created mode for the last hour...)
Tests are passing
@mariusvniekerk, were you wanting @DTAIEB to add the `postRunCell` trigger? Or leave that for a separate PR? He's got the case object defined, but I don't see it being triggered anywhere.
@chipsenkbeil yes, I would prefer to add it in a separate PR.
Going ahead and merging this one in.
May as well.   It's harmless
This can probably be merged in.  We might want to bump slightly further since I think coursier is a few milestones ahead
Whooh

LGTM. Thanks for tackling this.

No problem. I happened to still have my old 2.0 conversion branch around pre rebase so it was pretty simple pulling the pieces out we need

I will close this one... We can do a more comprehensive PR once the 0.1.x release is accepted.

Bit of a noob here - didn't know about `make all-travis`.  However, I see similar issues running that command against a pure master branch.  This, and given all I changed was the examples image tag, implies there's a general build issue.  Unfortunately, I don't have the necessary experience to determine what's going on - so I'm hoping someone can take a look.
Thanks.
Can you pin the docker container to something.  Just the current hash should do.

I've been trying to test local changes to toree by running `make dev`, however my changes were never taken into account.

According to the makefile, the docker image used in `make dev` [already has a version of toree installed](https://github.com/jupyter/docker-stacks/blob/master/all-spark-notebook/Dockerfile#L31) and this version seems to take precedence over the locally built one. Is this intended behaviour?
btw `make jupyter` has the same issue

Yeah, looks like the /opt/conda location is taking precedence.  I'm sure this is unintentional. 

ls -l /usr/local/share/jupyter/kernels/toree/lib
total 24656
-rw-r--r-- 1 root staff 25245269 Jan 30 18:04 toree-assembly-0.2.0.dev1-incubating-SNAPSHOT.jar
root@668912c73a70:/# ls -l /opt/conda/share/jupyter/kernels/apache_toree_scala/lib/
total 24628
-rw-r--r-- 1 jovyan users 25217052 Nov 21 15:56 toree-assembly-0.2.0.dev1-incubating-SNAPSHOT.jar
`root        13     8 21 Jan30 ?        01:14:12 /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java -cp /usr/local/spark/conf/
:/usr/local/spark/jars/* -Xmx1g ...  --class org.apache.toree.Main /opt/conda/share/jupyter/kernels/apache_toree_scala/lib/toree-assembly-0.2.0.dev1-incubating-SNAPSHOT.jar --profile /home/jovyan/.local/share/jupyter/runtime/kernel-2abb036b-363f-40fe-8056-99795f15
1425.json`

You might try modifying the docker start command to include the notebook-dir to point at the copied tree...

`jupyter notebook --ip=* --no-browser --notebook-dir /usr/local/share/jupyter/kernels`

If that works we should consider it for this PR.

So I'm not entirely certain on this one.  

On the one hand, this more closely maps to what the Scala console does.  
The existing solution, however, more closely maps to the semantics of IPython.

I guess the real question is what the expectations of users are for this.  Most of the other heavily used jupyter kernels (ipykernel, irkernel, ijulia) will only return one output from a cell instead of a bunch.  

cc @lbustelo and @chipsenkbeil
Might be a better idea to have this in a magic similar to what `%showtypes on/off` does atm.

Appending --notebook-dir doesn't work (duh).  I don't see a command line option off hand.  However, it looks like you can use the kernel tab (once in the notebook) and change the kernel to 'toree' afterwhich ps shows the appropriate assembly jar (from /usr/local/share).

This should either be a CLI option, a togglable magic as @mariusvniekerk pointed out, or its own magic that evaluates code. We shouldn't change the default behavior since we are following the Jupyter protocol. Furthermore, changing such a fundamental action's response could break any consumers of Toree relying on the existing response handling.

If we add a toggleable option, the default should be as it currently is.

I agree with making this a toggleable option. This behavior is meant to
reflect that of other kernels and is an experience that users of kernels
expect.

@mariusvniekerk is there more necessary for this change?  I pinned the docker image to one supporting Spark 2 (assuming that's what your comment meant).

I think this is a very good short-term fix. LGTM

In the long-run, we may even want to consider using a bare-bones distro docker image and install required dependencies as we need them. This would also address the double-inclusion issue we're currently seeing with toree.

It looks like the Play JSON 2.5 is not available for Scala 2.10. The latest compatible version is [2.4.10]( http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cgav%7C1%7Cg%3A%22com.typesafe.play%22%20AND%20a%3A%22play-json_2.10%22)
